author: David Anderson
title: Thibaut Courtois believes Chelsea 'will do whatever' to keep Antonio Conte at Stamford Bridge long-term
text:
Courtois wants Conte to commit (Photo: PA)   Thank you for subscribing!   
Thibaut Courtois claims Chelsea “will do whatever” to convince Antonio Conte to commit his long-term future to Stamford Bridge. 
Chelsea want to reward Conte for guiding the Blues to the brink of a fifth Premier League title with an improved contract to replace his current £6.5million-a-year deal. 
They are keen to tie him down to the Bridge beyond 2019 and ward off interest from Inter Milan, who would love to lure Conte back home to Serie A. 
Conte , 47, is understood to want assurances from Chelsea before he signs that they will spend big this summer to bankroll a tilt at the Champions League, which is his next big target. 
Courtois has backed Chelsea to reach an agreement with the former Juventus coach because they understand the Italian’s value to the club. Courtois has been discussing Conte's future (Photo: AFP/Getty) 
“The talks are maybe just rumours, I don’t know,” said the Belgium goalkeeper. “But he’s important for the club. 
“I think the club knows that so they will do whatever to have a happy ending.” 
Conte is already planning for next season and wants to be reunited with his former Juventus striker Alvaro Morata at Chelsea.
